commits.message:
loki: enable setting the timestamp() option with quoted strings

This is a convention in syslog-ng, so this is how the users expect it
to work.

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

news: add entry for #4688

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

Merge pull request #4688 from alltilla/loki-timestamp-option-string-param

loki: enable setting the timestamp() option with quoted strings

pull_request.title: loki: enable setting the timestamp() option with quoted strings
pull_request.body:
This is a convention in syslog-ng, so this is how the users expect it to work.

Related issue: https://github.com/kube-logging/logging-operator/issues/1555

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

issue.title: Yum Install dependency collision with rsyslog
issue.body:
# syslog-ng

## Version of syslog-ng
latest (3/14/17)
```

## Platform

RHEL7

# Issue
syslog-ng fails to install via standard yum install.

## Failure
syslog-ng package wants to write to /etc/logrotate.d/syslog.  Systems with rsyslog installed report this as a dependency violation.

## Optimal fix
configure package to use /etc/logrotate.d/syslog-ng to avoid future collision.

comment.body: Why is there no documentation anywhere for 3.5.6 in EPEL 🥲

issue.title: App specific transformations
Metrics related crash in 4.4
issue.body:
# syslog-ng
## Version of syslog-ng
4.4

# Issue
## Failure
```
'AF_INET(192.168.131.137:601)', group_name='main_input', location='/etc/syslog-ng/config/syslog-ng.conf:12:13', max='60'
Bail out! ERROR:lib/stats/stats-cluster.c:357:stats_cluster_untrack_counter: assertion failed: (self->use_count > 0)
**
ERROR:lib/stats/stats-cluster.c:357:stats_cluster_untrack_counter: assertion failed: (self->use_count > 0)
```
We saw different kind of crashes, like segfaults, too.
The crash comes after tcp connection rejects caused by max-connections, but that might not be related.
This change might be related: https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/pull/4582

4.3 does not crash.

commits.message:
metrics-probe: move label_buffers to TLS

A metrics-probe() instance might be used in multiple threads at
the same time, so it must be stateless.

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

news: add entry for #4685

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

pull_request.title: metrics-probe: move label_buffers to TLS
pull_request.body:
A `metrics-probe()` instance might be used in multiple threads at the same time, so it must be stateless.

Fixes #4677.

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

commits.message:
cfg-grammar: fix setting template-escape() in template block

The template_item nonterminal overwrites the value of $0, so
we need to set it again.

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

Merge pull request #4686 from alltilla/template-escape-fix-invalid-write

cfg-grammar: fix setting template-escape() in template block

pull_request.title: cfg-grammar: fix setting template-escape() in template block
pull_request.body:
The template_item nonterminal overwrites the value of $0, so we need to set it again.

Bug was catched via valgrind:
```
==2803776== Invalid read of size 1
==2803776==    at 0x491A973: log_template_set_escape (templates.c:298)

==2803776==    by 0x48CD526: main_loop_read_and_init_config (mainloop.c:692)

==2803776==    at 0x484B27F: free (in /usr/libexec/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)

Triggered by `scl/osquery/plugin.conf`
```
template t_osquery {
  template("\"${ISODATE}\",\"${HOST}\",\"${LEVEL_NUM}\",\"${FACILITY}\",\"${PROGRAM}\",\"${ESCAPED_MESSAGE}\"\n");
  template_escape(no);
};
```

comment.body: Sorry for the bug, looks good to me. Maybe we should somehow make this part of the grammar safer, I just needed to eliminate the recursion related issues, but it would be great to make this somehow typesafe.

issue.title: How to use the Oracle sql driver?
issue.body:
I try to sent my log messages to an Oracle database, however at startup it says:

    [2023-10-25T14:49:47.638825] No such DBI driver; type='oracle'

```
destination d_oracle {
   sql(
      type(oracle),
      database("TDHCP01"),
      username("RADIUS_HFC"),
      password("secret"),
      table("RADACCT_HFC_IPDATA"),
      columns("TS", "IP", "CLIENTMAC", "OPTION82", "SID", "LEASE_END"),
      values("${TS}", "${IP}", "${CLIENTMAC}", "${OPTION82}", "${SID}", "${LEASE_END}" ),
...
   );
};
```

Environment variables `ORACLE_HOME` and `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` are set.
I think the drivers are installed:

```
echo $ORACLE_HOME
/opt/app/oracle/product/12.1.0/client_1
echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/opt/app/oracle/product/12.1.0/client_1/lib


# rpm -qa syslog-ng*
syslog-ng-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-http-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-sql-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-smtp-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-mongodb-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64

# rpm -qa libdbi*
libdbi-0.9.0-19.el7.x86_64
libdbi-drivers-0.9.0-5.el7.x86_64
libdbi-dbd-sqlite-0.9.0-5.el7.x86_64

syslog-ng --version
syslog-ng 4 (4.4.0)
Config version: 4.2
Installer-Version: 4.4.0
Revision: 
Compile-Date: Sep 26 2023 06:22:47
Module-Directory: /usr/lib64/syslog-ng
Module-Path: /usr/lib64/syslog-ng
Include-Path: /usr/share/syslog-ng/include
Available-Modules: add-contextual-data,affile,afprog,afsocket,afstomp,afuser,appmodel,basicfuncs,cef,confgen,correlation,cryptofuncs,csvparser,disk-buffer,examples,graphite,hook-commands,json-plugin,kvformat,linux-kmsg-format,map-value-pairs,metrics-probe,pacctformat,pseudofile,rate-limit-filter,regexp-parser,sdjournal,stardate,syslogformat,system-source,tags-parser,tfgetent,timestamp,xml,afsql,afsmtp,azure-auth-header,http,afmongodb
```

It there a special `libdbi-dbd-oracle` driver? On Fedora I did not find any: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/czanik/syslog-ng43/build/6210454/

Built Packages:
    libdbi-dbd-mysql 0.9.0
    libdbi-dbd-pgsql 0.9.0
    libdbi-dbd-sqlite 0.9.0
    libdbi-drivers 0.9.0
    libdbi-drivers-debuginfo 0.9.0


On the same machine we also use Perl script to insert data into Oracle, so the Oracle drivers seems to be installed properly.


Do you have any help?
Wernfried

comment.body:
You are right, Oracle support is missing. The libdbi-drivers package needs to be compiled with Oracle support. However, that needs closed source Oracle libraries, and those are not allowed in Copr, the build service, where I compile my packages.

If you want, you can modify the libdbi-drivers package to support Oracle, but I cannot help in that (I do not have an Oracle environment).

Closing with "not planned".

issue.title: How to use the Oracle sql driver?
issue.body:
I try to sent my log messages to an Oracle database, however at startup it says:

    [2023-10-25T14:49:47.638825] No such DBI driver; type='oracle'

```
destination d_oracle {
   sql(
      type(oracle),
      database("TDHCP01"),
      username("RADIUS_HFC"),
      password("secret"),
      table("RADACCT_HFC_IPDATA"),
      columns("TS", "IP", "CLIENTMAC", "OPTION82", "SID", "LEASE_END"),
      values("${TS}", "${IP}", "${CLIENTMAC}", "${OPTION82}", "${SID}", "${LEASE_END}" ),
...
   );
};
```

Environment variables `ORACLE_HOME` and `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` are set.
I think the drivers are installed:

```
echo $ORACLE_HOME
/opt/app/oracle/product/12.1.0/client_1
echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/opt/app/oracle/product/12.1.0/client_1/lib


# rpm -qa syslog-ng*
syslog-ng-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-http-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-sql-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-smtp-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64
syslog-ng-mongodb-4.4.0-1.el7.x86_64

# rpm -qa libdbi*
libdbi-0.9.0-19.el7.x86_64
libdbi-drivers-0.9.0-5.el7.x86_64
libdbi-dbd-sqlite-0.9.0-5.el7.x86_64

syslog-ng --version
syslog-ng 4 (4.4.0)
Config version: 4.2
Installer-Version: 4.4.0
Revision: 
Compile-Date: Sep 26 2023 06:22:47
Module-Directory: /usr/lib64/syslog-ng
Module-Path: /usr/lib64/syslog-ng
Include-Path: /usr/share/syslog-ng/include
Available-Modules: add-contextual-data,affile,afprog,afsocket,afstomp,afuser,appmodel,basicfuncs,cef,confgen,correlation,cryptofuncs,csvparser,disk-buffer,examples,graphite,hook-commands,json-plugin,kvformat,linux-kmsg-format,map-value-pairs,metrics-probe,pacctformat,pseudofile,rate-limit-filter,regexp-parser,sdjournal,stardate,syslogformat,system-source,tags-parser,tfgetent,timestamp,xml,afsql,afsmtp,azure-auth-header,http,afmongodb
```

It there a special `libdbi-dbd-oracle` driver? On Fedora I did not find any: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/czanik/syslog-ng43/build/6210454/

Built Packages:
    libdbi-dbd-mysql 0.9.0
    libdbi-dbd-pgsql 0.9.0
    libdbi-dbd-sqlite 0.9.0
    libdbi-drivers 0.9.0
    libdbi-drivers-debuginfo 0.9.0


On the same machine we also use Perl script to insert data into Oracle, so the Oracle drivers seems to be installed properly.


Do you have any help?
Wernfried

pull_request.title: cfg-grammar: fix setting template-escape() in template block
pull_request.body:
The template_item nonterminal overwrites the value of $0, so we need to set it again.

Bug was catched via valgrind:

issue.title: Metrics related crash in 4.4
issue.body:
# syslog-ng
## Version of syslog-ng
4.4

# Issue
## Failure
```
'AF_INET(192.168.131.137:601)', group_name='main_input', location='/etc/syslog-ng/config/syslog-ng.conf:12:13', max='60'
Bail out! ERROR:lib/stats/stats-cluster.c:357:stats_cluster_untrack_counter: assertion failed: (self->use_count > 0)
**
ERROR:lib/stats/stats-cluster.c:357:stats_cluster_untrack_counter: assertion failed: (self->use_count > 0)
```
We saw different kind of crashes, like segfaults, too.
The crash comes after tcp connection rejects caused by max-connections, but that might not be related.
This change might be related: https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/pull/4582

4.3 does not crash.

pull_request.title: metrics-probe: move label_buffers to TLS
pull_request.body:
A `metrics-probe()` instance might be used in multiple threads at the same time, so it must be stateless.

Fixes #4677.

Signed-off-by: Attila Szakacs <attila.szakacs@axoflow.com>

issue.title: macOS CMake check fails
issue.body:
- CI: Re-enabled cmake check build step in the CI Action
- cmake/autotools: Started to add separate test mock implementations that also make it possible to use the mocked versions of the syslog-ng lib functions even on macOS

Fixes: https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/issues/4625

Signed-off-by: hofione@gmail.com

issue.title: Add option to turn on/off all example modules
issue.body:
This is a bit more generic version of https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/pull/4660 that allows switching on/off all the example modules both in cmake and autotools builds

- Removed autotools, and `example_destination` example only compile switch ENABLE_EXAMPLE_DESTINATION
- Added example modules wide common option ENABLE_EXAMPLE_MODULES both to autotools and cmake builds


Signed-off-by: Hofi <hofione@gmail.com>

comment.body:
I never used those targets myself, do maybe we can drop them?

On Tue, Oct 24, 2023, 15:44 Hofi ***@***.***> wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In modules/examples/Makefile.am
> <https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/pull/4668#discussion_r1370179555>:
>
> > @@ -39,4 +40,6 @@ EXTRA_DIST += modules/examples/CMakeLists.txt
>
>  modules/examples modules/examples/ mod-examples: modules/examples/libexamples.la
>
> +endif
>
> They are there to make per-module compilation work.
>
> my problem is that it is absolutely stochastic if it's presented or not,
> and not a strict habit/requirement/rule, so, it's hard to decide if it's
> really needed to not.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/syslog-ng/syslog-ng/pull/4668#discussion_r1370179555>,
> or unsubscribe
